title: Moveable bridge
summary: A moveable bridge, or movable bridge, is a bridge that moves to allow passage  for boats or barges.[1] In American English, the term is synonymous with drawbridge, and the latter is the common term, but drawbridge can be limited to the narrower, historical definition used in some other forms of English, in which drawbridge refers to only a specific type of moveable bridge often found in castles .
